alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 5:16PM CDT until April 13 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... DeSoto County in northwestern Mississippi... Northwestern Marshall County in northwestern Mississippi... Southeastern Tunica County in northwestern Mississippi... Tate County in northwestern Mississippi... North central Quitman County in northwestern Mississippi... Northern Panola County in northwestern Mississippi... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 516 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Walls to Phillipp to near Dubbs, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Senatobia, Batesville, Sardis, Coldwater, Como, Walls, Crenshaw, Lake Cormorant, Strayhorn, Pleasant Grove, Eudora, Dubbs, Lewisburg, Arkabutla, Barr and Lynchburg. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: DeSoto; Marshall; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica
